docs.lead_paragraph: Costa Rica's social security system has agreed to extend medical benefits to same-sex couples, in a fresh step toward equal rights for gays and lesbians in Latin America.

headline.main: Costa Rica to Offer Medical Benefits to Same-Sex Couples
headline.print_headline: Costa Rica to Offer Medical Benefits to Same-Sex Couples

docs.snippet: Costa Rica's social security system has agreed to extend medical benefits to same-sex couples, in a fresh step toward equal rights for gays and lesbians in Latin America.

docs.lead_paragraph: In France, brand new trains, it turns out, are too fat to squeeze into many train stations, which at least proves that bureaucratic dysfunction knows no boundaries.
docs.abstract: Editorial contends blunder made by French railway operator SNCF, in which it ordered 341 new-generation rail cars that are too wide to pass through 1,300 older stations, will cost tens of millions of euros to fix; maintains Americans angered by dysfunction in their own institutions can at least find solace that bureaucratic dysfunction knows no boundaries.
docs.snippet: In France, brand new trains, it turns out, are too fat to squeeze into many train stations, which at least proves that bureaucratic dysfunction knows no boundaries.

keywords.value: SNCF (Societe Nationale des Chemins de fer Francais)
keywords.name: organizations

docs.lead_paragraph: Sales of used homes rose to a seasonally adjusted annual rate of 4.65 million in April, up 1.3 percent from March.

headline.main: Home Resales Rise, but the Pace Lags
headline.print_headline: Home Resales Rise, but the Pace Lags

docs.abstract: National Association of Realtors reports that sales of existing homes rose to a seasonally adjusted annual rate of 4.65 million in April, up 1.3 percent from March; Labor Department reports that number of people seeking weekly unemployment benefits rose 28,000 to a seasonally adjusted 326,000.
docs.snippet: Sales of used homes rose to a seasonally adjusted annual rate of 4.65 million in April, up 1.3 percent from March.

docs.lead_paragraph: President Barack Obama will nominate San Antonio Mayor Julian Castro to become housing secretary and will tap Shaun Donovan, his current housing chief, to run the budget office, a White House official said Thursday.

headline.main: White House: Obama to Add Julian Castro to Cabinet
headline.print_headline: White House: Obama to Add Julian Castro to Cabinet

docs.snippet: President Barack Obama will nominate San Antonio Mayor Julian Castro to become housing secretary and will tap Shaun Donovan, his current housing chief, to run the budget office, a White House official said Thursday.

docs.lead_paragraph: CNBC report answers frequently-asked questions about long-term health insurance: Who needs it, when should you buy it and, if you’re healthy, should you even consider it?
docs.snippet: CNBC report answers frequently-asked questions about long-term health insurance: Who needs it, when should you buy it and, if you’re healthy, should you even consider it?

headline.main: Where You Live Matters for Lifesaving Liver Transplants

docs.abstract: A recent analysis found the farther patients lived from a Veterans Administration liver transplant center, the more likely they were to die waiting for a transplant.
docs.snippet: A recent analysis found the farther patients lived from a Veterans Administration liver transplant center, the more likely they were to die waiting for a transplant.

docs.lead_paragraph: Millions of Americans have Type 2 diabetes, and drug and device companies are racing to tap into the multibillion-dollar market, adding confusion and raising costs.

headline.main: Type 2 Diabetics Face a Flood of Drugs and Tests
headline.print_headline: Type 2 Diabetics Face a Flood of Drugs and Tests

docs.snippet: Millions of Americans have Type 2 diabetes, and drug and device companies are racing to tap into the multibillion-dollar market, adding confusion and raising costs.

docs.lead_paragraph: The uproar over medical care for veterans involves one of the nation’s biggest health care systems; to provide history and context, here are answers to some of the most pressing questions.

headline.main: History and Context of an Embattled Department of Veterans Affairs
headline.print_headline: History and Context of an Embattled Department

docs.abstract: Q&A provides history and context behind an embattled Department of Veterans Affairs.
docs.snippet: The uproar over medical care for veterans involves one of the nation’s biggest health care systems; to provide history and context, here are answers to some of the most pressing questions.
